thread.title: New trial denied for Baylor's Sam Ukwuachu in rape case
thread.title_full: New trial denied for Baylor's Sam Ukwuachu in rape case

title: New trial denied for Baylor's Sam Ukwuachu in rape case
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest New trial denied for Baylor's Sam Ukwuachu in rape case Baylor transfer Sam Ukwuachu has been denied a new trial in the rape case that he is currently serving a six-month sentence for, according to KVUE's news partners at the Austin American-Statesman. Post to Facebook New trial denied for Baylor's Sam Ukwuachu in rape case Baylor transfer Sam Ukwuachu has been denied a new trial in the rape case that he is currently serving a six-month sentence for, according to KVUE's news partners at the Austin American-Statesman.  //kvue.tv/1N2zEqI   New trial denied for Baylor's Sam Ukwuachu in rape case KVUE 11:15 a.m. CDT October 26, 2015 BOISE, ID - SEPTEMBER 20: Michael Alisa #42 of the BYU Cougars tries to evade a tackle by Samuel Ukwuachu #82 of the Boise State Broncos at Bronco Stadium on September 20, 2012 in Boise, Idaho. (Photo: Otto Kitsinger III, Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WACO -- Baylor transfer Sam Ukwuachu has been denied a new trial in the rape case that he is currently serving a six-month sentence for , according to KVUE's news partners at the Austin American-Statesman. 
The Baylor Bears defensive end was found guilty in August of sexually assaulting a female student athlete in October 2013. The case has called into question how the school handled the sexual assault and Ukwuachu's transfer into the program. 
Since the sexual assault case surfaced, University of Texas football Head Coach Charlie Strong has voiced his opinion on the university's handling of the transfer. He said a coach has to do their research on the transferring player. He also added that a culture of disrespect toward women should not be allowed on the coach's part. 
After Ukwuachu serves his six-month sentence, he will be on probation for 10 years. If he violates the probation, he will be sent to prison for eight years. Read or Share this story: http://kvue.tv/1N2zEqI TOP VIDEOS
